Package ev3dev.sensors

Class EV3Key

  • java.lang.Object
    • ev3dev.sensors.EV3Key
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    lejos.hardware.Key
    public class EV3Key
extends java.lang.Object
implements lejos.hardware.Key
    Implementation of the Key interface for EV3.

    The easiest way to get an instance of this class is to use one of the static constants of the Button class.

    Author:
    Anthony, Juan Antonio Brenha Moral, Jaroslav Tupy

      • isUp

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        true for released, false otherwise

      • waitForPress

        public void waitForPress()
        A blocking call that will return once this key gets pressed.

        This method returns immediately if this key is pressed already.

        Specified by:
        waitForPress in interface lejos.hardware.Key

      • waitForPressAndRelease

        public void waitForPressAndRelease()
        A blocking call that will first wait for this key being pressed and then it waits for this key being released.

        Unlike waitForPress(), this method will always block because this key cannot be already pressed and released at the same time. At the least, this key will be pressed so this method will only wait for it to be released.

        Specified by:
        waitForPressAndRelease in interface lejos.hardware.Key

      • addKeyListener

        public void addKeyListener​(lejos.hardware.KeyListener keyListener)
        Adds a listener for this key's 'pressed' and 'released' events.

        If this is the Button#ALL key, the listener will be getting notifications for any key events.

        Specified by:
        addKeyListener in interface lejos.hardware.Key
        Parameters:
        keyListener - keyListener

      • removeKeyListener

        public void removeKeyListener​(lejos.hardware.KeyListener keyListener)
        Removes the given key event listener.
        Parameters:
        keyListener - keyListener
